meanings.definition: Sail or travel all the way around (something, especially the world).
meanings.sent1: The brave explorer decided to circumnavigate the globe in search of new lands.
meanings.sent2: The ship will circumnavigate the island to reach the other side.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous sailor wanted to circumnavigate the world to prove his courage.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to circumnavigate the vast ocean was as strong as steel.
meanings.sent5: The idea to circumnavigate the entire planet filled him with excitement and wonder.

meanings.definition: Go around or avoid (an obstacle or problem).
meanings.sent1: To avoid traffic, we had to circumnavigate the construction zone.
meanings.sent2: She had to circumnavigate the issue delicately to prevent any conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox managed to circumnavigate the farmer's traps and reach the henhouse.
meanings.sent4: He tried to circumnavigate the difficult conversation by changing the topic.
meanings.sent5: Her ability to circumnavigate problems made her a valuable team member.
